newsitem.title: UK: MOTOR RACING-FRENTZEN SIGNED TO REPLACE HILL.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-FRENTZEN SIGNED TO REPLACE HILL.

text.p: German driver Heinz-Harald Frentzen was named on Wednesday as the replacement for current Grand Prix leader Damon Hill in the Williams Formula One team next season.
Briton Hill, who has been with Williams for the past six years, could clinch the drivers' title in Sunday's Italian Grand Prix at Monza.
A statement from Williams on Wednesday said Frentzen, 29, would join Canadian driver Jacques Villeneuve next year.
Hill was dropped from the Williams' team after contract negotiations broke down last week and he now looks likely to move to the British Jordan team.
Frentzen, now with Sauber, has not won a Grand Prix, but is regarded as one of the fastest drivers on the circuit.
"Damon has contributed greatly to the team both as a test and a race driver," Williams team director Frank Williams said on Wednesday.
"I think his record speaks for itself as very few drivers have ever approached his record of 20 wins in 64 starts."
